means: （戏剧、电影或音乐会的）幕间休息

sentence.Network_en: Check the oil at regular intervals, and have the car serviced regularly.
sentence.Network_cn: 定期检查汽油，并对车辆进行定期维护。

sentence.Network_en: George struggled wildly, going under and resurfacing at regular intervals.
sentence.Network_cn: 乔治疯狂地挣扎，不断在水面上浮浮沉沉。

sentence.Network_en: Make a point of backing up your files at regular intervals.

entry.def: An interval between two events or dates is the period of time between them.

example.ex: The ferry service has restarted after an interval of 12 years...
example.tran: 时隔12年之后，轮渡服务又重新开通了。

example.ex: There was a long interval of silence.
example.tran: 中间有很长时间的沉默。

entry.def: An interval during a film, concert, show, or game is a short break between two of the parts.

example.ex: During the interval, wine was served...
example.tran: 幕间休息时有葡萄酒供应。

example.ex: England were two goals behind at the interval.
example.tran: 中场休息时英格兰队落后两球。

entry.def: In music, an interval is the difference in pitch between two musical notes.
If something happens at intervals, it happens several times with gaps or pauses in between.

example.ex: She woke him for his medicines at intervals throughout the night.
example.tran: 她夜里每隔一段时间就叫他起来服药。

entry.tran: 以…的间距;每隔…远的距离
entry.def: If things are placed at particular intervals, there are spaces of a particular size between them.

example.ex: Several red and white barriers marked the road at intervals of about a mile...
example.tran: 路上设有几处红白相间的路障，相互间隔约一英里。

example.ex: The trees which gave the road its name stood at regular intervals along the kerb...
example.tran: 这条道路得名于这些树木，它们沿两边的路缘间隔均匀地排列着。

Sentence.sentence: She'd wake up early, turn on her laptop and chat on Internet dating sites and instant-messaging programs – leaving her bed for only brief intervals.

Since luxury is a function of scarcity, the children of tomorrow will long for nothing more than intervals of freedom from all the blinking machines, streaming videos and scrolling headlines that leave them feeling empty and too full all at once.
